intro: Ophioprason, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to parts of Europe, Asia, and Africa, and is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, with a flowering head that produces yellow ray florets. Its root system is tuberous, and it can form dense colonies in suitable environments. Ophioprason is generally considered a weed but has some traditional medicinal uses in certain cultures.
